papers.summary: Two short papers to be presented as posters -- one on language models and one on graph neural networks
Survey paper on memory-augmented graph neural networks from a neuroscience perspective
Work on the representational format of memories in short- and long-term memory
A large group effort paper describing neuroimaging analysis methods (e.g. inverted encoding model) with code examples demonstrating use of the open-source software library BrainIAK
Work with UT Austin on transfer learning between language representations

conferences.summary: Organizing in-person Memory in Artificial and Real Intelligence (MemARI) workshop [website]
Collaborator Mariya Toneva (Princeton, Max Planck SWS) presented joint work on 'Language models that can remember'

conferences.venue: From Neuroscience to Artificially Intelligent Systems (NAISys) at CSHL
conferences.summary: Poster summarizing our neuroscience-inspired efforts to improve long-range abilities of language models
Virtual talk at the 'Mechanisms, functions, and methods for diversity of neuronal and network timescales' workshop

summary: Paper on representations in short-term and long-term memory accepted to Cerebral Cortex

conferences.summary: Lightning talks on (1) multi-timescale LSTM encoding models and (2) NLP and neural taskonomy
Organized workshop, ''How can findings about the brain improve AI systems?''
